1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		cmdPath.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  **		R.K. Owen, <rk@owen.sj.ca.us> or <rkowen@nersc.gov>	     **
13   |  ** 									     **
14   |  **   Description:	The path manipulation routines. Much of the heart of **
15   |  **			Modules is contained in this file. These routines    **
16   |  **			are responsible for adding and removing directories  **
17   |  **			from given PATH-like variables.			     **
18   |  ** 									     **
19   |  **   Exports:		cmdSetPath					     **
20   |  **			cmdRemovePath					     **
21   |  ** 									     **
22   |  **   Notes:								     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
25   |  ****/
26   | 
27   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
28   |  ** 									     **
29   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
30   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
31   |  ** 									     ** 
32   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
33   | 
34   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: cmdPath.c.src.html,v 1.8 2009/09/01 20:22:32 rkowen Exp $";
35   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
36   | 
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
39   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
40   | 
41   | #include "modules_def.h"
42   | #ifdef	HAS_SYS_PARAM_H
43   | #include <sys/param.h>
44   | #endif
45   | 
46   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
47   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | 
50   | /** not applicable **/
51   | 
52   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
53   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | 
56   | #ifdef	MAXPATHLEN
57   | #define	PATH_BUFLEN	MAXPATHLEN
58   | #else
59   | #define	PATH_BUFLEN	1024
60   | #endif
61   | 
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | 
66   | #define _TCLCHK(a)	\
67   | 	{if (*(TCL_RESULT(a))) ErrorLogger(ERR_EXEC,LOC,TCL_RESULT(a),NULL);}
68   | 
69   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
70   | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
71   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
72   | 
73   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
74   | static char buffer[ PATH_BUFLEN];
75   | 
76   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
77   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
78   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
79   | 
80   | static int	Remove_Path( Tcl_Interp	*interp, char *variable, char *item, 
81   | 			char *sw_marker, const char *delim);
82   | 
83   | 
84   | /*++++
85   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  **   Function:		cmdSetPath					     **
88   |  ** 									     **
89   |  **   Description:	Add the passed value (argv[2]) to the specified vari-**
90   |  **			able (argv[1]). argv[0] specifies, if the variable   **
91   |  **			is to be appended or prepended.  Each directory in   **
92   |  **			the path is checked to see whether it is already     **
93   |  **			in the path.  If so it is not added.		     **
94   |  **			(Handles options -d C, or --delim[=]C )		     **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
99   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
100  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
101  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
102  |  ** 									     **
103  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
104  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
105  |  ** 									     **
106  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
107  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
108  |  **					control everything		     **
109  |  ** 									     **
110  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
111  |  ++++*/
112  | 
113  | int cmdSetPath(
114  | 	ClientData client_data,
115  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
116  | 	int objc,
117  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
118  | ) {
119  | 	Tcl_RegExp      chkexpPtr;		/** Regular expression for   **/
120  | 						/** marker checking	     **/
121  | 	char           *oldpath,		/** Old value of 'var'	     **/
122  | 	               *newpath,		/** New value of 'var'	     **/
123  | 	               *sw_marker = APP_SW_MARKER,
124  | 						/** arbitrary default	     **/
125  | 	    *startp = NULL, *endp = NULL,	/** regexp match endpts	     **/
126  | 	    *qualifiedpath,			/** List of dirs which 
127  | 						    aren't already in path   **/
128  | 	    **pathlist,				/** List of dirs	     **/
129  | 	    *arg;				/** argument ptr	     **/
130  | 	const char     *delim = _colon;		/** path delimiter	     **/
131  | 	int             append = 1,		/** append or prepend	     **/
132  | 	    numpaths,				/** number of dirs in path   **/
133  | 	    qpathlen,				/** qualifiedpath length     **/
134  | 	    arg1 = 1,				/** arg start		     **/
135  | 	    x;					/** loop index		     **/
136  |     /**
137  |      **  Whatis mode?
138  |      **/
139  | 	if (g_flags & (M_WHATIS | M_HELP))
140  | 		goto success0;
141  | 
142  |     /**
143  |      **   Check arguments. There should be at least 3 args:
144  |      **     argv[0]  -  prepend/append
145  |      **     ...
146  |      **     argv[n-1]-  varname
147  |      **     argv[n]  -  value
148  |      **/
149  | 	if (objc < 3)
150  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
151  | 				      " path-variable directory", NULL))
152  | 			goto unwind0;
153  | 
154  |     /**
155  |      **  Should this guy be removed from the variable ... If yes, do so!
156  |      **/
157  | 	if (g_flags & M_REMOVE)
158  | 		return (cmdRemovePath(client_data, interp, objc, objv));
159  | 								   /** ----> **/
160  | 
161  |     /**
162  |      **  prepend or append. The default is append.
163  |      **/
164  | 	if (!(append = !!strncmp(Tcl_GetString(objv[0]), "pre", 3)))
165  | 		sw_marker = PRE_SW_MARKER;
166  | 
167  |     /**
168  |      **  Non-persist mode?
169  |      **/
170  | 
171  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
172  | 		return (TCL_OK);
173  | 	}
174  | 
175  |     /**
176  |      **  Display only ... ok, let's do so!
177  |      **/
178  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
179  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
180  | 		while (--objc)
181  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*++objv));
182  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
183  | 		goto success0;
184  | 	}
185  | 
186  |     /**
187  |      **  Check for the delimiter option
188  |      **/
189  | 	arg = Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1]);
190  | 	if (*arg == '-') {
191  | 		if (!strcmp(arg, "-d")) {
192  | 			delim = Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]);
193  | 			arg1 += 2;
194  | 		} else if (!strcmp(arg, "--delim")) {
195  | 			delim = Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]);
196  | 			arg1 += 2;
197  | 		} else if (!strncmp(arg, "--delim=", 8)) {
198  | 			delim = arg + 8;
199  | 			arg1++;
200  | 		}
201  | 	}
202  | 
203  |     /**
204  |      **  Get the old value of the variable.
205  |      **  (MANPATH defaults to "/usr/man" -- removed).
206  |      **  Put a \ in front of each '.' and '+'.
207  |      **  (this is an intentional memory leak)
208  |      **/
209  | 	oldpath =
210  | 	    (char *)Tcl_GetVar2(interp, "env", Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1]),
211  | 				TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
212  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
213  | 
214  | #if 0
215  | 	    if (oldpath == NULL)
216  | 		oldpath = !strcmp(Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1]),
217  | 			    "MANPATH") ? "/usr/man" : "";
218  | #else
219  | 	    if (oldpath == NULL)
220  | 		oldpath	= "";
221  | #endif
222  | 
223  |     /**
224  |      **  Split the new path into its components directories so each
225  |      **  directory can be checked to see whether it is already in the 
226  |      **  existing path.
227  |      **/
228  | 	if (!(pathlist = uvec_vector(SplitIntoList(
229  | 			Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]), &numpaths, delim))))
230  | 		goto unwind0;
231  | 
232  |     /**
233  |      **  Some space for the list of paths which
234  |      **  are not already in the existing path.
235  |      **/
236  | 	if ((char *)NULL == (qualifiedpath =
237  | 	     stringer(NULL, 0, Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]), delim, NULL)))
238  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
239  | 			goto unwind1;
240  | 
241  | 	qpathlen = strlen(qualifiedpath) + 1;
242  | 	*qualifiedpath = '\0';		/** make sure null for later	     **/
243  | 
244  | 	for (x = 0; x < numpaths; x++) {
245  | 
246  | 		cleanse_path(pathlist[x], buffer, PATH_BUFLEN);
247  | 
248  | 	/**
249  | 	 **  Check to see if path is already in this path variable.
250  | 	 **  It could be at the 
251  | 	 **     beginning ... ^path:
252  | 	 **     middle    ... :path:
253  | 	 **     end       ... :path$
254  | 	 **     only one  ... ^path$
255  | 	 **/
256  | 		if ((char *)NULL == (newpath = stringer(NULL, 0,
257  | 			"(^", buffer, delim, ")|(", delim, buffer,
258  | 			delim, ")|(", delim, buffer, "$)|(^", buffer,
259  | 			"$)", NULL)))
260  | 			if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
261  | 				goto unwind2;
262  | 
263  | 		chkexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, newpath);
264  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
265  | 		null_free((void *)&newpath);
266  | 
267  | 	/**
268  | 	 **  If the directory is not already in the path, 
269  | 	 **  add it to the qualified path.
270  | 	 **/
271  | 		if (!Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, chkexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath))
272  | 			if ((char *)NULL ==
273  | 			    stringer(qualifiedpath + strlen(qualifiedpath),
274  | 				     qpathlen - strlen(qualifiedpath),
275  | 				     pathlist[x], delim, NULL))
276  | 				if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
277  | 					goto unwind2;
278  | 
279  | 	}				/** End of loop that checks for 
280  | 					 ** already existent path
281  | 					 **/
282  |     /**
283  |      **  If all of the directories in the new path already exist,
284  |      **  exit doing nothing.
285  |      **/
286  | 	if (!*qualifiedpath)
287  | 		goto success1;
288  | 
289  | 	/* remove trailing delimiter */
290  | 	qualifiedpath[strlen(qualifiedpath) - 1] = '\0';
291  | 
292  |     /**
293  |      **  Some space for our newly created path.
294  |      **  We size at the oldpath plus the addition.
295  |      **/
296  | 	if ((char *)NULL == (newpath = stringer(NULL, strlen(oldpath) +
297  | 						strlen(qualifiedpath) + 2,
298  | 						NULL)))
299  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
300  | 			goto unwind2;
301  | 	*newpath = '\0';
302  | 
303  |     /**
304  |      **  Easy job to do, if the old path has not been set up so far ...
305  |      **/
306  | 	if (!strcmp(oldpath, "")) {
307  | 		strcpy(newpath, qualifiedpath);
308  | 
309  |     /**
310  |      **  Otherwise we have to take care on prepending vs. appending ...
311  |      **  If there is a append or prepend marker within the variable (see
312  |      **  modules_def.h) the changes are made according to this markers. Other-
313  |      **  wise append and prepend will be relative to the strings begin or end.
314  |      **/
315  | 
316  | 	} else {
317  | 
318  | 		Tcl_RegExp      markexpPtr =
319  | 		    Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, sw_marker);
320  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
321  | 
322  | 		    strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
323  | 
324  | 		if (Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, markexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath)) {
325  | 			_TCLCHK(interp);
326  | 			Tcl_RegExpRange(markexpPtr, 0,
327  | 			    (CONST84 char **)&startp,
328  | 			    (CONST84 char **)&endp);
329  | 
330  | 	    /**
331  | 	     **  Append/Prepend marker found
332  | 	     **/
333  | 			if (append) {
334  | 				char            ch = *startp;
335  | 				*startp = '\0';
336  | 				strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
337  | 		/**
338  |                  ** check that newpath has a value before adding delim
339  |                  **/
340  | 				if (strlen(newpath) > 0
341  | 				    && newpath[strlen(newpath) - 1] != *delim)
342  | 					strcat(newpath, delim);
343  | 				strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
344  | 				if (newpath[strlen(newpath) - 1] != *delim)
345  | 					strcat(newpath, delim);
346  | 				*startp = ch;
347  | 				strcat(newpath, startp);
348  | 
349  | 			} else {
350  | 				char            ch = *endp;
351  | 				*endp = '\0';
352  | 				strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
353  | 				if (newpath[strlen(newpath) - 1] != *delim)
354  | 					strcat(newpath, delim);
355  | 				strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
356  | 				*endp = ch;
357  | 				strcat(newpath, endp);
358  | 			}
359  | 
360  | 		} else {
361  | 
362  | 	    /**
363  | 	     **  No marker set
364  | 	     **/
365  | 			if (!append) {
366  | 				strcpy(newpath, qualifiedpath);
367  | 				if (*oldpath != *delim)
368  | 					strcat(newpath, delim);
369  | 				strcat(newpath, oldpath);
370  | 			} else {
371  | 				strcpy(newpath, oldpath);
372  | 				if (newpath[strlen(newpath) - 1] != *delim)
373  | 					strcat(newpath, delim);
374  | 				strcat(newpath, qualifiedpath);
375  | 			}
376  | 		} /** if( marker) **/
377  | 	} /** if( strcmp) **/
378  |     /**
379  |      **  Now the new value to be set resides in 'newpath'. Set it up.
380  |      **/
381  | 	moduleSetenv(interp, Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1]), newpath, 1);
382  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
383  |     /**
384  |      ** Free resources
385  |      **/
386  | 	null_free((void *)&newpath);
387  | success1:
388  | 	null_free((void *)&qualifiedpath);
389  | 	/* FreeList(pathlist, numpaths); */
390  | success0:
391  | 	return (TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
392  | unwind2:
393  | 	null_free((void *)&qualifiedpath);
394  | unwind1:
395  | 	/* FreeList(pathlist, numpaths); */
396  | unwind0:
397  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
398  | }
399  |   /** End of 'cmdSetPath' **/
400  | 
401  | /*++++
402  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
403  |  ** 									     **
404  |  **   Function:		cmdRemovePath					     **
405  |  ** 									     **
406  |  **   Description:	Remove the passed value (argv[2]) from the specified **
407  |  **			variable (argv[1]). In case of switching this pro-   **
408  |  **			cedure removes markers from the path, too. argv[0]   **
409  |  **			specifies, if the append- or prepend-marker is af-   **
410  |  **			fected						     **
411  |  ** 									     **
412  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
413  |  ** 									     **
414  |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
415  |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
416  |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
417  |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
418  |  ** 									     **
419  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
420  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
421  |  ** 									     **
422  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
423  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
424  |  **					control everything		     **
425  |  ** 									     **
426  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
427  |  ++++*/
428  | 
429  | int cmdRemovePath(
430  | 	ClientData client_data,
431  | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
432  | 	int objc,
433  | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
434  | ) {
435  | 	char           *sw_marker = APP_SW_MARKER,
436  | 						/** arbitrary default	     **/
437  | 	    **pathlist,				/** List of dirs	     **/
438  | 	    *arg;				/** argument ptr	     **/
439  | 	const char     *delim = _colon;		/** path delimiter	     **/
440  | 	int             numpaths,		/** number of dirs in path   **/
441  | 	                arg1 = 1,		/** arg start		     **/
442  | 	    x;					/** loop index		     **/
443  |     /**
444  |      **   Check arguments. There should be give 3 args:
445  |      **     argv[0]  -  prepend/append/remove-path
446  |      **     ...
447  |      **     argv[n-1]-  varname
448  |      **     argv[n]  -  value
449  |      **/
450  | 	if (objc < 3)
451  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
452  | 				"path-variable directory", NULL))
453  | 			goto unwind0;
454  | 
455  |     /**
456  |      **  Non-persist mode?
457  |      **/
458  | 
459  | 	if (g_flags & M_NONPERSIST) {
460  | 		return (TCL_OK);
461  | 	}
462  | 
463  |     /**
464  |      **  Display only ... ok, let's do so!
465  |      **/
466  | 	if (g_flags & M_DISPLAY) {
467  | 		fprintf(stderr, "%s\t ", Tcl_GetString(objv[0]));
468  | 		while (--objc)
469  | 			fprintf(stderr, "%s ", Tcl_GetString(*++objv));
470  | 		fprintf(stderr, "\n");
471  | 		goto success0;
472  | 	}
473  | 
474  |     /**
475  |      **  prepend or append. The default is append.
476  |      **/
477  | 	if (!strncmp(Tcl_GetString(objv[0]), "pre", 3))
478  | 		sw_marker = PRE_SW_MARKER;
479  | 
480  |     /**
481  |      ** For switch state3, we're looking to remove the markers.
482  |      **/
483  | 	if (g_flags & M_SWSTATE3)
484  | 		Tcl_SetStringObj(objv[arg1 + 1], sw_marker, -1);
485  | 
486  |     /**
487  |      **  Check for the delimiter option
488  |      **/
489  | 	arg = Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1]);
490  | 	if (*arg == '-') {
491  | 		if (!strcmp(arg, "-d")) {
492  | 			delim = Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]);
493  | 			arg1 += 2;
494  | 		} else if (!strcmp(arg, "--delim")) {
495  | 			delim = Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]);
496  | 			arg1 += 2;
497  | 		} else if (!strncmp(arg, "--delim=", 8)) {
498  | 			delim = arg + 8;
499  | 			arg1++;
500  | 		}
501  | 	}
502  | 
503  |     /**
504  |      **  Split the path into its components so each item can be removed
505  |      **  individually from the variable.
506  |      **/
507  | 	if (! (pathlist =
508  | 	     uvec_vector(SplitIntoList(Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1 + 1]), &numpaths,
509  | 			   delim))))
510  | 		goto unwind0;
511  | 
512  |     /**
513  |      ** Remove each item individually
514  |      **/
515  | 	for (x = 0; x < numpaths; x++)
516  | 		if (TCL_OK !=
517  | 		    Remove_Path(interp, (char *)Tcl_GetString(objv[arg1]),
518  | 				pathlist[x], sw_marker, delim))
519  | 			goto unwind1;
520  |     /**
521  |      ** Free resources
522  |      **/
523  | 	/* FreeList(pathlist, numpaths); */
524  | 
525  | success0:
526  | 	return (TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
527  | 
528  | unwind1:
529  | 	/* FreeList(pathlist, numpaths); */
530  | unwind0:
531  | 	return (TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
532  | 
533  | } /** End of 'cmdRemovePath' **/
534  | 
535  | /*++++
536  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
537  |  ** 									     **
538  |  **   Function:		Remove_Path					     **
539  |  ** 									     **
540  |  **   Description:	This function actually does the work of removing     **
541  |  **			the item from the path.  It is done this way to      **
542  |  **			support multiple items (often directories)	     **
543  |  **			separated by colons in the variable value.	     **
544  |  ** 									     **
545  |  **   First Edition:	2001/08/08					     **
546  |  ** 									     **
547  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
548  |  **			char		*variable	Variable from which  **
549  |  **							to remove item	     **
550  |  **			char		*item		Item to remove	     **
551  |  **			char		*sw_marker	Switch marker	     **
552  |  **			const char	*delim		path delimiter	     **
553  |  ** 									     **
554  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
555  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
556  |  ** 									     **
557  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
558  |  **					this function is called in order to  **
559  |  **					control everything		     **
560  |  ** 									     **
561  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
562  |  ++++*/
563  | 
564  | static int	Remove_Path(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
565  | 	       			char		*variable,
566  | 	       			char		*item,
567  | 				char		*sw_marker,
568  | 				const char	*delim)
569  | {
570  |     char	*oldpath,			/** Old value of 'var'	     **/
571  |     		*tmppath,			/** Temp. buffer for 'var'   **/
572  |     		*searchpath,
573  | 		*startp=NULL, *endp=NULL;	/** regexp match endpts	     **/
574  |     int  	 start_offset = 0,		/** match offsets	     **/
575  |     		 end_offset = 0,
576  | 		 path_len = 0;			/** length of unmatched path **/
577  |     Tcl_RegExp	regexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
578  |     		begexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
579  |     		midexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
580  |     		endexpPtr  = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
581  |     		onlyexpPtr = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL,
582  |     		markexpPtr = (Tcl_RegExp) NULL;
583  |     /**
584  |      **  Get the current value of the "PATH" environment variable
585  |      **/
586  |     if( NULL == (tmppath = (char *) Tcl_GetVar2( interp, "env", variable,
587  | 	TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY))) {
588  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
589  | 	goto success0;			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
590  |     }    
591  | 
592  |     /**
593  |      **  We want to make a local copy of old path because we're going
594  |      **  to be butchering it and the environ one doesn't need to be
595  |      **  changed in this manner.
596  |      **  Put a \ in front of each . and + in the passed value to remove.
597  |      **/
598  |     if((char *) NULL == (oldpath = stringer(NULL,0, tmppath, NULL)))
599  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
600  | 	    goto unwind0;
601  |     path_len = strlen(oldpath);
602  |     cleanse_path( item, buffer, PATH_BUFLEN);
603  | 
604  |     /**
605  |      **  Now we need to find it in the path variable.  So, we create
606  |      **  space enough to build search expressions.
607  |      **/
608  |     if((char *) NULL == (searchpath = stringer(NULL,0,"^", buffer,
609  | 	delim, NULL)))
610  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
611  | 	    goto unwind1;
612  | 
613  |     /**
614  |      **  This section searches for the oldpath in the PATH variable.
615  |      **  There are four cases because the colons must be used as markers
616  |      **  in order to guarantee that a partial match isn't being found.
617  |      ** 
618  |      **  The start_offset and end_offset variables indicate how much to 
619  |      **  cut or not to cut off of each end of the located
620  |      **  string.  They differ for each case...beginning of
621  |      **  the path, middle of the path, end of the path, 
622  |      **  and for the only path.
623  |      ** 
624  |      **  This is to ensure the colons get cut off properly.
625  |      **/
626  | 
627  |     begexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp,  searchpath);
628  |     _TCLCHK(interp);
629  | 
630  |     if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, begexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
631  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
632  | 	regexpPtr = begexpPtr;
633  | 
634  | 	/**
635  | 	 **  Copy from the beginning of the startp to one
636  | 	 **  character before endp
637  | 	 **/
638  | 
639  | 	Tcl_RegExpRange(begexpPtr, 0,
640  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
641  | 	start_offset = 0; end_offset = -1;
642  | 	path_len -= (endp - startp - 1);
643  | 
644  |     } else {
645  | 
646  | 	*searchpath = *delim;	/* :buffer: */
647  | 	midexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
648  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
649  | 
650  | 	if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, midexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
651  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
652  | 	    regexpPtr = midexpPtr;
653  | 
654  | 	    /**
655  | 	     **  Copy from one character after stringp[0] to one
656  | 	     **  character before endp[0]
657  | 	     **/
658  | 
659  | 	    Tcl_RegExpRange(midexpPtr, 0,
660  | 		(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
661  | 	    start_offset = 1; end_offset = -1;
662  | 	    path_len -= (endp - startp - 2);
663  | 
664  | 	} else {
665  | 
666  | 	    searchpath[strlen(searchpath)-1] = '$';	/* :buffer$ */
667  | 	    endexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
668  | 	    _TCLCHK(interp);
669  | 
670  | 	    if( Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, endexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
671  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
672  | 		regexpPtr = endexpPtr;
673  | 
674  | 		/**
675  | 		 **  Copy from one character after stringp[0] 
676  | 		 **  through endp[0]
677  | 		 **/
678  | 
679  | 		Tcl_RegExpRange(endexpPtr, 0,
680  | 			(CONST84 char **) &startp, (CONST84 char **) &endp);
681  | 		start_offset = 0; end_offset = 0;
682  | 		path_len -= (endp - startp - 1);
683  | 
684  | 	    } else {
685  | 
686  | 		*searchpath = '^';	/* ^buffer$ */
687  | 		onlyexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, searchpath);
688  | 		_TCLCHK(interp);
689  | 
690  | 		if(Tcl_RegExpExec(interp, onlyexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0) {
691  | 		    _TCLCHK(interp);
692  | 
693  | 		    /**
694  | 		     **  In this case, I should go ahead and unset the variable
695  | 		     **  from the environment because I'm removing the very last
696  | 		     **  path.
697  | 		     **
698  | 		     **  First I'm going to clear the variable from the
699  | 		     **  setenvHashTable just in case its already been altered
700  | 		     **  and had a significant value at the time. It's very
701  | 		     **  possible that I'm removing the only two or three paths
702  | 		     **  from this variable. If that's the case, then all the
703  | 		     **  earlier paths were marked for output in this hashTable.
704  | 		     **
705  | 		     **  Secondly, I actually mark the the environment variable
706  | 		     **  to be unset when output.
707  | 		     **/
708  | 		    mhash_del(setenvHashTable, variable);
709  | 		    moduleUnsetenv(interp, variable);
710  | 
711  | 		    /**
712  | 		     **  moduleUnsetenv doesn't unset the variable in the Tcl
713  | 		     **  space because the $env variable might need to be
714  | 		     **  used again in the modulefile for locating other
715  | 		     **  paths.  BUT, since this was a path-type environment
716  | 		     **  variable, the user is expecting this to be empty
717  | 		     **  after removing the only remaining path.  So, I set
718  | 		     **  the variable empty here.
719  | 		     **/
720  | 		    (void) Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, "",
721  | 			TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
722  | 		    _TCLCHK(interp);
723  | 		    null_free((void *) &searchpath);
724  | 		    goto success1;
725  | 		}
726  | 	    }
727  | 	}
728  |     }
729  |     null_free((void *) &searchpath);
730  | 
731  |     /**
732  |      **  If I couldn't find it assume it wasn't there
733  |      **  and return.
734  |      **/
735  |     if( !regexpPtr)
736  | 	goto success1;
737  | 
738  |     markexpPtr = Tcl_RegExpCompile(interp, sw_marker);
739  |     _TCLCHK(interp);
740  | 
741  |     /**
742  |      **  In state1, we're actually replacing old paths with
743  |      **  the markers for future appends and prepends.
744  |      **  
745  |      **  We only want to do this once to mark the location
746  |      **  the module was formed around.
747  |      **/
748  |     if((g_flags & M_SWSTATE1) && ! (Tcl_RegExpExec(interp,
749  | 	 markexpPtr, oldpath, oldpath) > 0)) {
750  | 
751  | 	/**
752  | 	 **  If I don't have enough space to replace the oldpath with the
753  | 	 **  marker, then I must create space for the marker and thus
754  | 	 **  recreate the PATH variable.
755  | 	 **/
756  | 	char* newenv;
757  | 	int newlen = path_len + strlen(sw_marker) + 1;
758  |       
759  | 	if((char *) NULL==(newenv = stringer(NULL, newlen ,NULL) ))
760  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
761  | 		goto unwind1;
762  | 
763  | 	*(startp + start_offset) = '\0';
764  | 
765  | 	if(*(endp + end_offset) == '\0') {
766  | 	    (void) stringer(newenv, newlen, oldpath,delim,sw_marker,NULL);
767  | 	} else {
768  | 	    (void) stringer(newenv, newlen, oldpath,sw_marker,
769  | 		endp + end_offset, NULL);
770  | 	}
771  | 
772  | 	/**
773  | 	 **  Just store the value with the marker into the environment.  I'm not
774  | 	 **  checking if it changed because the only case that a PATH-type
775  | 	 **  variable will be unset is when I remove the only path remaining in
776  | 	 **  the variable.  So, using moduleSetenv is not necessary here.
777  | 	 **/
778  | 	Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, newenv, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
779  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
780  | 	null_free((void *) &newenv);
781  | 
782  |     } else {  /** SW_STATE1 **/
783  | 
784  | 	/**
785  | 	 **  We must be in SW_STATE3 or not in SW_STATE at all.
786  | 	 **  Removing the marker should be just like removing any other path.
787  | 	 **/
788  | 	strcpy( startp + start_offset, endp);
789  | 
790  | 	/**
791  | 	 **  Cache the set.  Clear the variable from the unset table just
792  | 	 **  in case it was previously unset.
793  | 	 **/
794  | 	mhash_add(setenvHashTable, variable, oldpath);
795  | 	mhash_del(unsetenvHashTable, variable);
796  | 
797  | 	/**
798  | 	 **  Store the new PATH value into the environment.
799  | 	 **/
800  | 	Tcl_SetVar2( interp, "env", variable, oldpath, TCL_GLOBAL_ONLY);
801  | 	_TCLCHK(interp);
802  | 
803  |     }  /** ! SW_STATE1 **/
804  |     /**
805  |      **  Free what has been used and return on success
806  |      **/
807  | success1:
808  |     null_free((void *) &oldpath);
809  | success0:
810  |     return( TCL_OK);		/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
811  | 
812  | unwind1:
813  |     null_free((void *) &oldpath);
814  | unwind0:
815  |     return( TCL_ERROR);		/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
816  | 
817  | } /** End of 'Remove_Path' **/
